data.title: MOHAMAD REZA PAHLAVI. The Shah's Story.
data.meta_description: MOHAMAD REZA PAHLAVI. The Shah's Story. London, Michael Joseph,1980.8vo. Publisher's blue cloth, spine lettered in gilt; in the original pictorial dust wrapper (price-clipped); pp. [viii], 240; internally bright and clean, a near fine copy in the very good wrapper, ownership inscription in Farsi on front fly-leaf. Firs
data.text:
MOHAMAD REZA PAHLAVI. The Shah's Story. London, Michael Joseph,1980.

8vo. Publisher's blue cloth, spine lettered in gilt; in the original pictorial dust wrapper (price-clipped); pp. [viii], 240; internally bright and clean, a near fine copy in the very good wrapper, ownership inscription in Farsi on front fly-leaf.

First edition. Translated from the French by Teresa Waugh. An autobiography by the former Shah of Iran, detailing his former years and time as the leader of Iran, as well as the circumstances around his voluntary exile. An account by the man 'at the eye of the story' (front flap).
